content.description: Sit start on edges in the crack, pull on and bump the right hand back to another crimp, adjust feet and then make a move up with the left to a good sloper. From here you can resettle yourself and pull up and onto the slab portion of the arete for an easy topout. Stand start variation starting matched on undercling feature, making one slightly harder move up to the same sloper and then shares the same finish.
content.location: Starts at the base of the left arete on the Lost Crag Slab.

content.description: Stand start in the middle of the slab, move straight up using a variety of ribbed crimps on the slab; continue up to the horizontal crack and then from there move up through more crimps to an easy topout at the highest point of the slab.
content.location: In the middle of the Lost Slab, the most obvious line going directly up the center of the slab.

content.description: Start standing at the base of the crack, walk up the slab using the crack as a layback/undercling, continue on from the top of that crack left through the horizontal to the highest point of the boulder and the same topout at Slabby McSlab Face.
content.location: Right side of the Lost Crag Slab, starting at the base of the obvious left angling crack to the high point on the boulder.

content.description: Stand start on an edge in the middle of the wall, move straight up using jugs and edges in the crack and on the face of the boulder. Top out directly above the start of the climb with good holds.
content.location: Left side of the boulder, left of Sleepwalking.

content.description: The Lost Crag Slab is a short slab wall that hosts a few easier slab problems and a fun sit start arete problem that has a harder stand start variation; don't see that too often!
